meanings.definition: The quality or state of being faint.
meanings.sent1: Her face turned pale with faintness after seeing the scary movie.
meanings.sent2: The faintness of the light made it hard to see in the dark room.
meanings.sent3: The faintness of the kitten's meow made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The faintness of the music in the distance added to the eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The faintness of the scent of fresh flowers filled the room delicately.

meanings.definition: A feeling of dizziness or lightheadedness.
meanings.sent1: She experienced faintness and had to sit down to regain her balance.
meanings.sent2: The sudden faintness made him grab onto the railing for support.
meanings.sent3: The faintness from spinning in circles made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The faintness of the altitude made her head swim as she climbed higher.
meanings.sent5: The faintness of the scent of lavender caused a wave of dizziness.

meanings.definition: A lack of strength or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The faintness of the weak tea disappointed her taste buds.
meanings.sent2: The faintness of the breeze barely moved the leaves on the tree.
meanings.sent3: The faintness of the apology left her feeling unsatisfied.
meanings.sent4: The faintness of the voice on the phone made it hard to hear.
meanings.sent5: The faintness of the colors in the painting made it look washed out.

meanings.sent1: He experienced faintness and collapsed on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The doctor quickly attended to the patient's faintness.
meanings.sent3: The faintness during the play made the audience gasp in concern.
meanings.sent4: The faintness at the sight of blood caused her to faint.
meanings.sent5: The faintness after standing up too quickly passed after a few moments.
